questions.text: Actively growing phase of hair is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: All of the following are types of Lichen planus except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A sexually active male presented with warts on his penis as shown below. Which of these strains of HPV is most commonly the cause of these lesions?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

HPV 6,11
 Anogenital warts / Condyloma Acuminata (Condyloma = knuckle, Acuminata = pointed)
Anogenital warts are produced by the low risk HPV Types: HPV-6 and HPV-11. They are often asymptomatic, soft, pink, elongated and sometimes filiform or pedunculated. The lesions are usually multiple especially on moist surfaces, and their growth can be enhanced during pregnancy, or in the presence of other local infections. 
Sites:  Men (Frenulum, corona and glans), Women (Posterior fourchette in women) correspond to the likely sites of greatest coital friction.

questions.text: A histopathological image of the skin biopsy of a patient given below is suggestive of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pemphigus vulgaris
Pemphigus vulgaris is a chronic vesiculobullous skin disorder characterised by autoantibodies against Desmoglein 3, which is a component of the desmosome (an intracellular adhesion molecule). Late disease Desmoglein-1 also gets involved. Disruption of keratinocyte adhesion leads to superficial blistering and erosion affecting the skin and/or mucous membranes.
Histology of pemphigus vulgaris
Suprabasal epidermal acantholysis, clefting and blister formation. The blister cavity may contain inflammatory cells and rounded acantholytic cells with hyperchromatic nucleus and perinuclear halo. The floor of the blister may be lined with intact keratinocytes referred to as the “Row of tombstone appearance”. Dermal changes include perivascular inflammatory infiltrate particularly with eosinophils.

questions.text: What is the most probable diagnosis based on the given image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Basal cell carcinoma (BCC) constitutes about 70% of keratinocyte tumors that comprise 90% of all malign skin diseases. It is slow growing, locally invasive tumour which rarely metastasizes.
Nodular basal cell carcinoma comprises about 60-80% of the cases and occurs most often on the skin of the head. Clinically it is presented by elevated, exophytic pearl-shaped nodules with telangiectasia on the surface. Subsequently, nodular BCC can extend into ulcerative or cystic pattern. The lesions with big sizes and the central necrosis are defined as Rodent ulcers.

questions.text: An 18 years old male presented with pruritus over fingers. The clinical picture of the lesion and the causative agent is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Scabies 
Scabies: Itchy, contagious, skin ectoparasitic infection
Special Lesion: Burrow

questions.text: Which of the following causative organism is responsible for this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Coxsackie A16 
Hand Foot mouth Disease
Etiology: Coxsackie A16/ Enterovirus 71
C/F: Papulovesicular lesions : Palms/ Soles/ Oral cavity/ Buttocks

choices.text: Intercellular deposits of IgG and C3

questions.text: A middle-aged lady presented to the OPD with painful blisters on the skin and oral mucosa. Direct immuno fluorescence was done as shown below. All the following are true about the disease pathogenesis except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Due to IgG against hemidesmosomes 
Diagnosis: Pemphigus Vulgaris
Target: Desmoglein-3, 1
DIF Image: Intercellular deposits of IgG and C3: Fishnet Pattern
Bullous Pemphigoid: IgG against hemidesmosomes

questions.text: A 24 years old female presented with complaints of rash on exposure to sun, after exercise, when she gets angry or on eating spicy food. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Cholinergic urticaria 
Cholinergic urticaria is due to increased core body temperature (Sweating/ exercise)

questions.text: A factory worker comes to you with itchy, annular scaly plaques in the groin. On prescribing corticosteroid ointment, there is significant relief in pruritus but the lesion continues to extend peripherally. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Tinea cruris 
Tinea cruris is called Jock/ Dhobi itch
Tinea modified by steroid application: Tinea Incognito

questions.text: A 28-year-old patient of neurocysticercosis develops generalized peeling of skin all over except palms and soles starting one month after taking anti-epileptics. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

TEN
TEN involves > 30 % of Body surface area
Pathogenesis: Keratinocyte necrosis

questions.text: A lady came with complaints of a bluish lesion over left side of forehead and left eye. An irregular bluish lesion in left superior conjunctive and forehead is seen. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Nevus of Ota
Nevus of Ota: Unilateral, Blue- Slate grey color
Distribution: First and Second division of Trigeminal Nerve
Sclera involvement in 2/3rd patients

questions.text: Which component of cement causes allergic contact dermatitis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Chromium
Allergic contact dermatitis is a type of contact dermatitis which is immunologically mediated and a Type 4 Hypersensitivity Reaction
Following are the commonly implicated allergens in contact dermatitis
a)	Metal: Nickel
b)	Cement: Potassium Dichromate
c)	Hair Dye: Para Phenylene Diamine
d)	Plant: Parthenium Hysterophorus

questions.text: A 30 years old male presented with silvery scales on elbow and knee, which bleed on removal. The probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Psoriasis 
•	Silvery white scales (due to air trapped between scales 
•	Removal of scales lead to appearance of punctuating/ pinpoint bleeding points (Auspitz sign)
•	Grattage test: Scratching with a glass slide accentuates scale formation in a psoriatic plaque.
•	Scaling is profuse in elephantine and rapid psoriasis. 
Seborrheic dermatitis:
•	Greasy scales 
Pityriasis rosea:
•	Collarette scales which are attached to peripheral edge and free towards center

questions.text: This nail finding is characteristically seen in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Correct Answer (A)

Lichen planus
Pterygium of the nail is a wing shaped fold connecting proximal nail fold to the nail bed

questions.text: A 16-yr. old student with h/o herpatic gingivostomatitis developed generalized and symmetrical rash more over palms and soles, 1-2 cm diameter round patches consisting of 3 concentric rings with a central dusky zone. Rashes burning and pruritic. Few erosive lesions in oral mucosa. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Erythema multiforme
Target Lesions: 3 Zones
MC Infection triggering Erythema multiforme: HSV-1 Infection

questions.text: Defect in epidermolysis bullosa dystrophic is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Papillary tip abscess is a finding seen in
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Collection of neutrophils on the dermal papillary tip in Dermatitis herpetiformis is called as Papillary tip abscess

choices.text: Presence of nuclei in stratum corneum

questions.text: Spongiosis is best described by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Acute Eczema patients have intercellular edema called as Spongiosis

questions.text: All of the following are characterised by hyperpigmented lesions except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) Nevus anemicus Melasma: Acquired hyper pigmentary disease (Symmetric brown coloured macules: Malar area)

Nevus anemicus
Melasma: Acquired hyper pigmentary disease (Symmetric brown coloured macules: Malar area)
Becker’s Nevus: Acquired, Unilateral, hyperpigmented, hypertrichotic macule over chest/ upper shoulder
Nevus of Ota: Dermal Melanocytosis: First and Second Division of Trigeminal Nerve, Unilateral, Colour: Blue to Slate Grey, Sclera (2/3) involvement
Nevus Anemicus: Congenital white patch of vasoconstriction

questions.text: What is the probable diagnosis in a 7 yr old boy from Bihar  with a 7 month history of ill-defined slightly raised atrophic macules on the face?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Indeterminate leprosy:
•	Mostly seen in children
•	There will be 1-3 hypopigmented macules with ill-defined edges
•	The sensations might be impaired and few thickened dermal nerves can be seen
•	The course too is indeterminate – can resolve spontaneously or progress to a severe disease.

questions.text: Lucio reaction is seen in which of the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Leprosy
Lucio reaction/phenomenon:
•It is a type of severe lepra reaction seen in long standing cases which occurs due to necrotising vasculitis.
•It leads to severe ulceration over the skin.

questions.text: About Pityriasis Rosea which of the following statements is false?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Branny scales
Branny Scales: Pityriasis versicolor
Pityriasis Rosea:
•	Acute self-limiting eruption
•	First Lesion: Mother / Herald Patch
•	Scales: Collarette
•	Distribution: Christmas tree distribution

questions.text: Which of the following anti acne medication causes blue black pigmentation of nails?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Minocycline:
•	It is one of the tetracyclines effective against acne
•	It is a lipophilic drug
•	Its absorption is decreased by the presence of dairy products
•	It produces a bluish black pigmentation of the nails and of pre-existing scars and sun exposed areas of the body.

Skin pigmentation- ABCD in MP

A: Arsenic- rain drop pigmentation
       Amiodarone- purple color
B: Busulphan, Bleomycin- generalized pigmentation
C- Clofazamine- orange pigmentaion
Contraceptives- melasma
Chlorpromazine
D- Dapsone
M- Minocycline- blue black pigmenation of mucosa/post acne
P- Psoralens

questions.text: What is Max–Joseph space associated with?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

In Lichen planus there is hydropic degeneration of stratum basal keratinocytes. These keratinocytes as lost leaving behind empty space known as Max Joseph space

questions.text: Terry nails are seen in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Patch test is read after
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Patch test Removed at 48 hours and read at 96 hours

questions.text: In Miliaria crystallina, obstruction of sweat duct is at the level of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Mialiaria crystallina: Obstruction at St Corneum
Mialiaria Rubra: Obstruction at St Malpigian
Mialiaria Profunda: Obstruction at D-E junction

questions.text: All of the following are side effects of Clofazimine therapy except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Peripheral neuropathy is a side effect of thalidomide

questions.text: The allergen implicated in Bindi dermatitis is ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Para Tertiary Butyl Phenol is the allergen in Bindi adhesive

questions.text: A 28-yr. old female presents with complaints of tightness of fingers. There is also history of dysphagia. Most likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Due to fibroblast proliferation we see tightening of fingers

questions.text: A child presents with multiple, discrete, skin-colored, 1- to 3-mm dome-shaped smooth papules on the face with central umbilication. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The classical pearly shiny papules with central umbilication is feature of Molluscum contagiosum

questions.text: Which layer of epidermis is underdeveloped in very low birth weight infants in the initial 7 days
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The last layer to form is startum corneuml. In prematurely born infant the layer missing is stratum corneum

questions.text: Which of the following cells not present in stratum basale layer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Langerhan’s cells are present in St Spinosum

questions.text: Which of the following is not a causative factor for acne?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Oily food is not associated with increased risk of acne. The food with high glycemic index and milk products are associated with increased risk of acne

questions.text: A female presented to the hospital with complaints of frothy discharge. Wet mount showed Trophozoite moving. Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Trichomoniasis presents with greenish frothy discharge associated with cervical inflammation. The causative organism is Trichomonas vaginalis.

questions.text: This is seen in ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: This is the image of xerophthalmia. It is due to Vitamin A deficiency. The initial symptom is delayed dark adaptation and later complete night blindness

questions.text: An adult male with multiple sexual partners comes with history of painless genital ulcer. What is the next Investigation of choice?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation:
A patient with painless hard ulcer and painless Lymph node is syphilis patient. The microscopy is done by Dark field microscopy where the motility of spirochete can be observed

questions.text: A patient with silvery micaceous scales as shown, diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: A well defined erythematous papule and plaque associated with silvery micaceous scale present on the extensor surface is a feature of Psoriasis.

questions.text: Tzanck smear is used to diagnose all except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: This is the image of multinucleated giant cell. In the patient of viral infection there is secondary acantholysis (damage to keratinocyte wall) leading to vesicles. On Tzanck smear we see MNGC.
